This provides a comprehensive and objective dataset for analysis, which may not be possible with traditional methods that rely on subjective visual inspection or limited chemical analysis.

Secondly, machine learning methods, such as partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA), support vector machine (SVM), and deep convolutional neural network (CNN), can effectively analyze the hyperspectral data and build discriminant models. These models can learn patterns and relationships within the data to accurately classify the geographical origins of the fruits.

Comparatively, traditional methods for identifying the geographical origins of dry narrow-leaved oleaster fruits may involve manual examination of physical properties or chemical analysis of specific compounds. These methods can be time-consuming, subjective, and may not provide a comprehensive understanding of the fruit's origin.
